intro: Hieracium saxifragum subsp. pseudextensum, commonly known as the saxifrage hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has basal rosettes of leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other Hieracium species.
